simplified: Your dreams can show you things you didn't know you were thinking about. Some people have similar dreams, like flying, falling, losing teeth or being naked in public. These dreams probably mean similar things to many people. But to understand what they mean to you, you need to think about what's happening in your life and how you're feeling. This can help you connect your dreams to your daily life and understand them better.
original: Your dreams might show you all kinds of insights into things that you didn't realise you were thinking about. Common dreams like being able to fly or falling, your teeth falling out or having no clothes on in a public place probably mean something similar in most people. But the key to understanding exactly what they mean to you is to connect them to the events and feelings in your daily life.

simplified: In Moscow, there are many wild dogs. About 35,000 dogs live on the streets. Some dogs were born wild, and some were pets that people didn't want anymore. Some dogs live alone, and some live in groups. Scientists studied the dogs in 2010. They found that the dogs are very good at living in the city. The dogs have learned to cross the street with people, and some even understand traffic lights.
original: One of the most interesting cases of wild animals living in a city are the wild dogs of Moscow. In Moscow, there are approximately 35,000 wild dogs living on the streets. Some of the dogs were born wild, while others are pets that have been abandoned by their owners. Some dogs live alone and others live in packs. In 2010, scientists studied the dogs and found that the dogs have adapted remarkably successfully to urban life. They have learned that it is safer to cross the street with people and some dogs appear to understand traffic lights.

simplified: RJ Palacio from New York wrote a book called Wonder. It's her first book. She got the idea for the book when she saw a girl on the street who looked different. The girl had a face that wasn't like most people's. Wonder is a very popular book in the US and has won some awards. Many schools are reading it and talking about important issues like being mean to others, having friends, and being different. A movie is being made from the book, and many people, including me, want to read her next book.
original: Wonder is New Yorker RJ Palacio's first novel. On her website, she explains that the idea for the book came to her after seeing a girl with facial deformities on the street one day. Wonder has been a bestseller in the United States and has already won several awards. Many schools are using it as a starting point for discussions about bullying, friendship and what it's like to be different. A film version is being made, and many, including me, are waiting eagerly to see what RJ Palacio writes next.

simplified: Chloe has two pet rats, Zena and Roxy. She knows that most people don't keep rats as pets, and she's often explained to them that rats are clean and nice pets if you take good care of them. But she understands why people don't like them. Chloe didn't like rats either, until her friend Martin showed her his rats. She saw that they were friendly and smart. When Martin's rats had babies, Chloe wanted two of them as pets.
original: Chloe has two pet rats, Zena and Roxy. Chloe knows they're not typical pets and she has lost count of the times she's patiently tried to explain to people that rats aren't dirty and they make fantastic pets if you look after them correctly. But she understands why people react badly. She didn't like rats either until her friend Martin showed her his pet rats and she saw how affectionate and intelligent they were. Last year, when one of Martin's rats had babies, Chloe decided she'd like to have two of them.

simplified: Cape Town can be a bad place for baboons. Some baboons get hurt or die in car accidents. Others get hurt by electricity when they play with electric wires. Baboons are in danger, so the city wants to help them. The city also wants to stop problems between people and baboons. To do this, they have a team of people called Baboon Monitors. These monitors chase baboons out of the city or catch them and take them to the countryside. This has helped a bit, but it's hard to keep baboons away from the city when they find food there easily.
original: Cape Town can be a dangerous place for baboons. Some have been injured or killed in car accidents and others have been electrocuted as they played with electric cables. Baboons are an endangered species and to save them and minimise conflicts between humans and baboons, the city council has employed a team of Baboon Monitors. The monitors' job is to chase baboons out of urban areas or catch them and release them in the countryside. This policy has had some success, though it is proving hard to stop baboons from coming back to the city once they see it as a source of easy food.

simplified: I work for a big computer company, but its main office is in the US. So, I do my job from home on the computer. This is good because I don't lose time traveling to work or talking to colleagues about things that are not important. I work on different projects, and I like that I can choose when I work. This means I can take time off when my kids have events at school or when I need to go to the doctor. The bad thing is that I often work late into the night because I don't have set working hours. Sometimes, I even skip dinner to finish my work.
original: I work for a global IT company, but because their headquarters is in the States, I do all my work online from home. That means that I don't waste time commuting or making idle chit-chat with colleagues. I work on a project basis, and this flexibility is very valuable to me because it means that I can easily take some time off when my children need me to go to their school performances or if I need to schedule an appointment with the dentist. The downside is that without clear office hours, I tend to work well into the evening, sometimes skipping dinner to finish a task.

simplified: In the 1990s, people still did graffiti, but a new kind of art became popular on streets all over the world. Some artists wanted to talk about important issues like war, unfairness, and treating people differently. They made art to make people think about these problems. Other artists just wanted to create nice and pretty things. In South America, many artists went to poor areas and painted on grey walls to make them more colourful and beautiful.
original: In the 1990s, graffiti continued but there was also an explosion in street art around the world. Some artists wanted to make political points and produced art that tried to make people think about war, inequality and discrimination. Other street artists were more concerned with producing beautiful, attractive work. In South America, many street artists went to work in poor areas adding colour, life and beauty to grey, city walls.

simplified: People see lots of things to buy every day on social media, in magazines, and in shop windows. British people are buying more clothes and shoes than they used to. It's easy to shop online without thinking, and big brands sell very cheap clothes. These clothes are so cheap that people wear them a few times and then throw them away.
original: Social media, magazines and shop windows bombard people daily with things to buy, and British consumers are buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. Online shopping means it is easy for customers to buy without thinking, while major brands offer such cheap clothes that they can be treated like disposable items – worn two or three times and then thrown away.

simplified: Sam looked away from the sun at the cloud of dust made by the car driving up to the Big House. The horses kicked and moved their tails to get rid of flies, and they didn't care that their owner was visiting for the first time in ten months. Sam waited. Mr Carter only came here when he had to, which was okay with Sam. The less he saw of his boss, the longer he could keep his job. Mr Carter wiped the sweat from his neck. There were wet spots on his shirt that looked like shapes on a map. His skin was already getting red from the sun in June. Usually, his skin was pale because he stayed indoors while others did the work, and he got paid for it.
original: Sam squinted against the sun at the distant dust trail raked up by the car on its way up to the Big House. The horses kicked and flicked their tails at flies, not caring about their owner's first visit in ten months. Sam waited. Mr Carter didn't come out here unless he had to, which was just fine by Sam. The more he kept out of his boss's way, the longer he'd have a job. Mr, Carter wiped the sweat from the back of his neck. The damp patches on his shirt drew together like shapes in an atlas. His skin was already turning ruddy in the June sun. Otherwise he had the indoor tan of a man that made money while other people did the work.

simplified: Many people in Berlin, Germany were upset about killing wild pigs. They thought it was too cruel. There were big arguments between people who hunt and people who love animals. The city leaders listened to the complaints and decided to try a kinder way to deal with the pigs. Instead of killing them, they built fences and made a rule that people cannot feed the pigs. We will have to wait and see if this works, but it might be difficult because warmer winters mean there are more pigs now than before.
original: Many city residents in Berlin, Germany complained that shooting pigs was unnecessarily cruel and there were heated arguments between hunters and animal lovers. In response to protests, the city council decided to take more peaceful action against pigs. Instead of shooting them, they have put up fences and made it illegal to feed the pigs. Time will tell if this strategy works, though it may be a losing battle as warmer winters mean that pig numbers are greater than in the past.

simplified:
The idea for the Hunger Games book came from Suzanne's love of old Greek stories. When she was a kid, she loved the story of Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, the city of Athens was controlled by the island of Crete. The people of Athens didn't like being ruled, so they rebelled. As a punishment, the king of Crete, Minos, made the Athenians send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. These young people were put into a complicated maze and eaten by a monster called the Minotaur that lived there. But one of the young people, named Theseus, fought the Minotaur and killed it. Suzanne thinks of Katniss Everdeen as a modern-day Theseus. 

Note: A labyrinth is a complicated maze, which is like a puzzle with many paths. It's hard to find your way out. In this story, it's where the Minotaur lives.
original: An important inspiration for the Hunger Games book comes from Suzanne's love of classical Greek mythology. When she was a child, one of her favourite stories was Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story the city of Athens is ruled by Crete, but the Athenians rebel. As a punishment, Minos the king of Crete forces the Athenians to send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. The youths are thrown into the labyrinth and eaten by a monster that lives there called the Minotaur. But one of the youths, named Theseus, fights the Minotaur and kills it. Suzanne sees Katniss Everdeen as a futuristic Theseus.

simplified: Zoos can help people learn about protecting animals and their homes. By showing people animals, zoos can inspire them to care about animals. Some zoos give a safe home to animals that were treated badly in circuses or by their owners. These zoos also try to learn more about animals, like how they behave and how to make them healthy again.
original: By bringing people and animals together, zoos have the potential to educate the public about conservation issues and inspire people to protect animals and their habitats. Some zoos provide a safe environment for animals which have been mistreated in circuses, or pets which have been abandoned. Zoos also carry out important research into subjects like animal behaviour and how to treat illnesses.

simplified: A new trend is starting to happen that goes against buying too much - the 'buy nothing' trend. This idea began in Canada in the early 1990s and then spread to the US. It's a reaction against spending too much money on things people don't really need, especially on big shopping days like Black Friday and Cyber Monday. On Buy Nothing Day, people organize protests and even cut up their credit cards. All year round, Buy Nothing groups swap and fix things they already have instead of buying new ones.
original: A different trend is springing up in opposition to consumerism – the 'buy nothing' trend. The idea originated in Canada in the early 1990s and then moved to the US, where it became a rejection of the overspending and overconsumption of Black Friday and Cyber Monday during Thanksgiving weekend. On Buy Nothing Day people organise various types of protests and cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, Buy Nothing groups organise the exchange and repair of items they already own.

simplified: Is graffiti art or vandalism? It depends on what you think. In many countries, it is against the law to write or paint on public or private property. This is because it can cause damage and cost a lot to clean. Many street artists get in trouble with the police and have to pay money. City councils also complain about the cost of removing graffiti from buildings, buses, and trains.
original: Is graffiti art or vandalism? This depends on your point of view, but in many countries, writing or painting on public or private property is considered vandalism. Many street artists have been stopped by the police and some have had to pay fines. Many city councils complain about the high cost of cleaning graffiti off buildings, buses and trains.

simplified: What does the art world think of graffiti and street art? More and more people are starting to see it as a real art form. There have been big exhibitions of street art in galleries in Paris, London and Los Angeles. An American artist, Elura Emerald, organised a street art show in a New York gallery in 2008. She said, 'Street artists are just expressing themselves and not hurting anyone. They deserve to be appreciated and celebrated'.
original: What does the art world think of graffiti and street art? Recently, there has been a growing recognition of its value as an art form. There have been major exhibitions of street art in galleries in Paris, London and Los Angeles. The American artist Elura Emerald organised a street art exhibition at a New York gallery in 2008. She defended street artists, saying 'artists who paint on the street are merely expressing themselves, not hurting anyone. They should be appreciated and celebrated'.

simplified: Most people have four to six dreams every night after they are ten years old. This means they have around 2,000 dreams per year. By the time they are 80 years old, they might have had around 140,000 dreams. We forget most of our dreams - about 95-99 percent of them. But we still remember a few thousand dreams in our lifetime. It's not surprising that sometimes a dream is followed by a similar event in real life. This can happen by chance, especially if the dream is about something that happens a lot in everyday life.
original: If most people have four to six dreams every night after the age of ten, that's as many as 2,000 dreams per year. So, by the time they reach 80 years old the average person might have had 140,000 dreams. Even if we forget 95–99 per cent of our dreams, that's still a few thousand remembered dreams across a lifetime. It's not too difficult to believe that, by coincidence, a dream event is followed by a real-life event that's similar to it, especially if the subject of the dream is something that happens often in everyday life.

simplified: The Hunger Games is set in the future. A long time ago, North America was destroyed. Now, there's a new country called Panem. It has twelve poor areas, and the rich city of Capitol is in charge. The Capitol has all the power. Each area makes something different for the Capitol. District 12, where the story starts, gives the country all its coal. There used to be a thirteenth area, but it tried to fight the Capitol and was destroyed.
original: The Hunger Games takes place in the future, after the destruction of North America. The country is called Panem and is made up of twelve poor districts governed by the wealthy Capitol. The Capitol holds absolute power over the nation. Each district is responsible for producing different things for the Capitol. District 12, where the story begins, provides all the coal for the country. There used to be a thirteenth district but they rebelled against the Capitol in the past and were destroyed.

simplified: Wild animals often go into cities to find food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons come into areas where people live on the edge of the city to eat. They open bins and eat fruit from gardens. Some baboons are very brave and go into people's houses to take food from kitchens and fridges. Baboons can be very aggressive and have hurt many pets, so many people in the city don't want them around.
original: Often wild animals come into cities to look for food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons have started coming into residential areas on the edge of the city to feed. They open rubbish bins and eat fruit from gardens and orchards. Some brave baboons have even come into people's houses and taken food from kitchen cupboards and fridges! Baboons can be aggressive and have attacked a lot of pet animals, so understandably, many city residents don't welcome their presence.

simplified: Many accidents happen when a bridge is being built. These accidents often happen because the engineers make a mistake, like a wrong calculation. The bridge can then fall down under its own weight, which can be very dangerous for the workers who are on it at that time.
original: A large number of bridge accidents occur during the construction of the bridge itself. These accidents are often due to an error made by the engineers, such as a miscalculation. The bridge collapses under its own weight, and this can be deadly for the workers on it at the time.

simplified: George Lucas was one of the first film directors to use a special story idea called the "hero's journey". This idea has 17 parts. Usually, the hero starts with a normal life, but then something happens and they go on a big adventure. At the start of Star Wars, Luke lives a normal life with his aunt and uncle. He fixes robots. When he finds a secret message from Princess Leia in a robot called R2D2, it's the start of his big adventure. This message is like a call to Luke to do something exciting and important. It changes his life and starts his journey.
original: George Lucas was one of the early film directors to directly base his story on the 17 stages of the hero's journey. Typically the hero starts the story living an ordinary life, but something happens that calls them to an adventure that changes everything. At the beginning of Star Wars, Luke lives an ordinary life with his aunt and uncle, repairing robots. When he finds Princess Leia's message to Obi-Wan Kenobi inside the robot R2D2, it is 'the call to adventure' that starts the hero on his journey.

simplified: One way to stop a big rock from hitting Earth is to blow it up with a powerful bomb. This might sound like a movie idea, and it was actually the plot of a 1998 film called Armageddon. But a team from NASA has a real plan called HAMMER. They want to shoot big rockets at the rock to push it off course. If the rock is too close to Earth, the rockets would carry special bombs to break it into pieces instead.
original: Another suggested defence against a PHA on course to hit Earth is to blow it up using a nuclear weapon. It may sound like a plot from a film, and it was the subject of the 1998 film Armageddon, but the Hypervelocity Asteroid Mitigation Mission for Emergency Response (HAMMER) is a genuine NASA proposal. The eight-ton rockets would be fired at an approaching asteroid with the hope of bumping it off course. If the asteroid was too close to Earth for this plan to work, the rockets would carry nuclear bombs to blow it up instead.

simplified: The hero doesn't want to go on a big journey at first, but then someone helps them and they decide to start. This person is like a teacher who shows them the way. The hero then goes into a new and different place where exciting things happen. Next, they have to do difficult tasks, fight bad people and meet new friends who help them. These friends help the hero get ready for the biggest problem they will face. For Luke, the teacher is Obi-Wan, his friends are Han Solo and two robots, and the bad person is Darth Vader. They are all in a special place called the Death Star.
original: According to Campbell, the hero at first refuses the call to adventure, but a mentor appears who helps them and they decide to 'cross the threshold' and travel into the 'special world' where the adventure happens. The next stage consists of passing tests, fighting enemies and meeting friends as the hero prepares to face their biggest challenge. For Luke the mentor is, of course, Obi-Wan, the friends are Han Solo and the robots R2D2 and C3PO and the enemy is Darth Vader inside the special world of the Death Star.

simplified: Some things that people do not use much may seem useless, but they can be useful to others. The internet has helped people find a way to make money from sharing things they do not use. There are websites and groups on social media where people can buy and sell things they no longer need. This makes it easy for people to share things with each other. This is called the sharing economy. It means that people can use things that others do not need, instead of buying new things.
original: Underutilised items may seem useless to some, but could be an asset to others. With the advent of the internet, online communities have figured out a way to generate profit from the sharing of those underused assets. Using websites and social media groups that facilitate the buying and selling of second-hand goods, it is now easier than ever for peer-to-peer sharing activities to take place. And this is known as the sharing economy.

simplified: Around the 18th and 19th centuries, people started to think about dreams in two different ways. One idea was that dreams show us things that we don't know about ourselves. A man named Freud thought that if we understand our dreams, we can understand our secret feelings and the problems they cause. The other idea was the opposite. It said that dreams are just a mix of random thoughts and pictures in our brain when it's working on memories from the day. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these random thoughts and feelings, and we create a story from them.
original: Around the 18th and 19th centuries two main ideas about dreams became popular. One was the idea that the things we see in our dreams represent things hidden from our conscious mind. Freud believed that if we understand what dreams are telling us, we can understand our hidden feelings and the problems they cause. However, the other theory was the opposite. It said that dreams are just a collection of random activity in the brain while it's organising memories and events from the day. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these random images and feelings and put them into some sort of story.

simplified: I work for myself, which is great. I can decide what I do and how I use my time. At first, I worked from home, but it was hard to focus. There were many things at home that needed my attention: cleaning, making another cup of tea, and my family wanted to talk to me. So, I started going to a café near my home to work. But the internet connection was not good, and I drank too much coffee. Now, I rent a desk in a shared office with five other people who work for themselves like me. I like getting ready to go to work in the morning and being in an office where I can concentrate.
original: I'm a freelancer and work for myself. This is great because I am in control of what I do and how I spend my time. At first, I was working from home, but I found it really hard to concentrate. There were just too many distractions around: housework that needed doing, another cup of tea, my family members wanting my attention for various things. So I started to go to a nearby café to work, but the Wi-Fi connection wasn't ideal and I found myself drinking too much coffee. In the end, I decided to rent a desk in a co-working space with five other freelancers like myself. I liked getting dressed to go to work in the morning and being able to focus in an office environment.

simplified: NASA needs money to build a special telescope called NEOCam to find the missing medium-sized asteroids. This telescope uses a special kind of light to find them. If they get the money, they might be able to find all of them in ten years. After they find them, they still need to figure out how to stop the dangerous ones from hitting the Earth. These dangerous asteroids are called PHAs, which means they are close to Earth and could hit us.
original: Whether NASA can find the remaining middle-sized NEOs depends on getting the money to build NEOCam, a 0.5-metre space telescope which would use infrared light to locate asteroids. If it did get the money, it could probably achieve its goal in ten years. Once logged, the planetary defence team would still need to work out how to defend the planet against being hit by the truly worrying asteroids – the PHAs.

simplified: There's a new trend called 'buy nothing'. Some famous people on social media usually tell their followers what clothes and make-up to buy. Now, some of them are telling people not to buy anything for a long time, even a year. Two friends in Canada tried this. For a year, they only bought food. At first, they didn't buy things like phones, clothes or things for their home. Then, they stopped using services like haircuts, eating in restaurants or putting petrol in their cars. After a year, they had saved $55,000.
original: The 'buy nothing' trend has now reached influencers on social media who usually share posts of clothing and make-up that they recommend for people to buy. Some YouTube stars now encourage their viewers not to buy anything at all for periods as long as a year. Two friends in Canada spent a year working towards buying only food. For the first three months they learned how to live without buying electrical goods, clothes or things for the house. For the next stage, they gave up services, for example haircuts, eating out at restaurants or buying petrol for their cars. In one year, they'd saved $55,000.

simplified: Religion is important to Pi. His family is Hindu, but he's interested in other religions too. He becomes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim who owns a bakery. Pi surprises everyone by saying he wants to be Hindu, Muslim, and Christian at the same time. His family and teachers tell him to pick just one, but Pi says, 'I just want to love God.' They're surprised by his answer, so they decide to let Pi choose his own way when it comes to religion.
original: Religion is important to Pi. Though his family is Hindu, he is curious about other religions and he makes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. To everyone's surprise, Pi declares himself to be simultaneously Hindu, Muslim and Christian. When his family and teachers ask him to choose just one religion, Pi refuses, saying 'I just want to love God'. From that moment, his family and teachers decide to let him make his own mind up about religion.

simplified: Some people think that writing down your dreams can help you have special dreams. These dreams are called lucid dreams. In a lucid dream, you know you're dreaming and you can control what happens. So, you can change a bad dream into a good one, or you can decide what happens next, like a movie director. Instead of just trying to understand your dreams, you can create them. But it's still good to have some dreams that help you understand what's on your mind, even if you're not in control.
original: Some people think writing your dreams down can open your mind to lucid dreaming. Lucid dreams are dreams where you're not only aware you're dreaming but you can make decisions to affect the events of your dreams. So, maybe you can turn a nightmare into a safe-feeling dream, or you can direct the plot of your dream like a film director. Then, instead of just working out the meaning of your dreams, you'll be creating them, though you might want to continue having some dreams that allow your subconscious to tell you what's on your mind!

simplified: People may think they are not part of the problem of throwing away clothes because they give their old clothes to charity. But charity shops can't sell all the clothes they get. Some clothes, like those from 'fast fashion', go out of style quickly and are not good enough to be worn again. People don't want to buy these clothes, so they get thrown away. A lot of clothes that charity shops can't sell are sent to other countries, which causes more problems for the economy and the environment. 'Fast fashion' means clothes that are made quickly and cheaply, and are often worn for a short time before being thrown away.
original: People might not realise they are part of the disposable clothing problem because they donate their unwanted clothes to charities. But charity shops can't sell all those unwanted clothes. 'Fast fashion' goes out of fashion as quickly as it came in and is often too poor quality to recycle; people don't want to buy it second-hand. Huge quantities end up being thrown away, and a lot of clothes that charities can't sell are sent abroad, causing even more economic and environmental problems.

simplified: Some adventurers today like to have many exciting experiences. Meagan McGrath from Canada is one of them. She has climbed the highest mountain on each continent, cycled across Canada and run a long-distance race in the Sahara Desert in very hot weather. But one of her most amazing trips was a skiing trip to the South Pole. On the first day, she had a big accident and fell into a glacier. She had to be rescued. Many people would have stopped at that point, but Meagan decided to continue. She finally reached the South Pole after forty days, pulling a sledge with a tent and food through very cold weather and ice storms.
original: Not content with one amazing trip, some of today's adventurers go from challenge to challenge. Meagan McGrath from Canada has climbed the highest mountain on each continent, ridden a bike across Canada and run a long-distance race in the Sahara Desert in 45ºC heat. But perhaps her most remarkable journey was a skiing trip to the South Pole. On the first day, she fell into a glacier and had to be rescued. Many of us would have given up at that point, but Meagan decided to carry on. She reached the South Pole forty days later, having pulled a sledge with a tent and all her food behind her through freezing conditions and ice storms.

simplified: Blek le Rat began by painting rats on walls in Paris, where he lives. Now, he wants people to think about problems in society. He paints pictures of people who don't have homes in big cities to help people think about this issue.
original: Blek le Rat started out painting rats on the walls of his home city, Paris. Nowadays, he tries to make people think about different social issues and problems. He paints pictures of homeless people in big cities to encourage residents to think about the problem of homelessness.

simplified: In some places, local governments want to stop artists from painting graffiti on walls without permission. So, they give them special areas where they can paint. Taiwan is a country that does this. They have special 'graffiti zones' where artists can paint and write on walls without problems. In São Paulo, a city in Brazil, the city government even lets some graffiti artists paint on the city's subway trains.
original: In some areas, councils have tried to encourage artists not to paint graffiti randomly on walls by allowing them to work in designated areas. Taiwan is one such place and there are 'graffiti zones' where artists are free to paint and write on walls. In São Paulo in Brazil, the city council has even allowed some graffiti artists to paint on the city's subway trains.

simplified: Faith47 is an artist from Cape Town in South Africa. She paints big, colourful pictures of people and animals. She likes to paint in different places. You can find her work on streets, in old factories and on old cars. She likes that her art doesn't last forever. It gets destroyed by the weather or cleaned by the city. This reminds her that life is always changing. Things end and new things start.
original: Faith47 is from Cape Town in South Africa. She paints big, colourful pictures of people and animals and likes to explore different locations. Her work is found on pavements, in empty factories and on abandoned cars. She likes the fact that most street art is temporary and will soon be removed by weather or cleaners from the city council. For her, this reflects how life is full of change with its cycle of endings and new beginnings.

simplified: Gabriela used to work in a place where people respect their bosses a lot. In this kind of workplace, the bosses make big decisions and people usually don't question them. But her team in Sweden was different. They were used to working together with their bosses to find answers and make decisions. In this kind of workplace, bosses help their team members and want them to think for themselves. They also expect their team members to tell them if they don't agree with something.
original: In her previous work environment, Gabriela was used to a high power distance culture where power and authority are respected and everyone has their rightful place. In such a culture, leaders make the big decisions and are not often challenged. Her Swedish team, however, were used to working in a low power distance culture where subordinates often work together with their bosses to find solutions and make decisions. Here, leaders act as coaches or mentors who encourage independent thought and expect to be challenged.

simplified: When Gabriela noticed the differences between her and her team, she started a conversation with them about how they felt about her as a leader. Her team was happy to share their thoughts. They said they didn't like being told exactly what to do all the time. They liked having the freedom to make some decisions and come up with their own ideas. When Gabriela told them exactly what she wanted, they felt she didn't think they could do their job properly. They explained that when they questioned or wanted to change her decisions, she took it as a personal attack. But they told her that's just how they normally worked, by discussing and trying to improve ideas.
original: When Gabriela became aware of the cultural differences between her and her team, she took the initiative to have an open conversation with them about their feelings about her leadership. Pleased to be asked for their thoughts, Gabriela's team openly expressed that they were not used to being told what to do. They enjoyed having more room for initiative and creative freedom. When she told her team exactly what she needed them to do, they felt that she didn't trust them to do their job well. They realised that Gabriela was taking it personally when they tried to challenge or make changes to her decisions, and were able to explain that it was how they'd always worked.

simplified: Os Gêmeos are twin brothers from São Paulo. They are artists and they paint many things like small signs and big, colourful pictures of people on buildings. Their paintings are often very big, so they need special machines called cranes to help them. In 2007, they painted a whole castle in Scotland.
original: Os Gêmeos are identical twin brothers from São Paulo. They paint everything from tags to huge, colourful pictures of people on the sides of buildings. Their work is often so big that they need cranes to help them work. In 2007, they covered the whole of a castle in Scotland with paint.

simplified: People have been drawing and writing on walls for a very long time. A long time ago, people in Africa and Europe drew pictures of animals and people on the walls of caves. You can also find drawings and writings on old buildings in countries like Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq. In a town called Pompeii, researchers found many examples of writings on walls in a language called Latin. These writings were about religion, politics, love, and even magic!
original: People have been painting and writing on walls throughout history. In prehistoric times, people in Africa and Europe used to paint pictures of animals and people in caves. Graffiti has been found on buildings at ancient sites in Greece, Italy, Syria and Iraq. In the Roman town of Pompeii, archaeologists have found numerous examples of graffiti written in Latin. These include religious, political and romantic messages, and even some magic spells!

simplified: Have you ever wanted to climb the highest mountain, Mount Everest, or walk to the South Pole? If so, you are not the only one. Every year, many people try to climb the highest mountains or walk across big areas of land. In the past, explorers used maps and special tools to find their way. Now, people on adventures use new technology like GPS, which helps them know where they are, and special phones that work from space. Many of these adventurers love nature and travel to tell people about problems with the environment. Others want to help people who need it and collect money for good causes.
original: Have you ever dreamt of climbing Mount Everest or walking to the South Pole? If so, you're not alone. Every year, thousands of people try to climb the world's highest mountains or walk across continents. Unlike the explorers of the past who used maps and compasses, today's adventurers travel with modern technology like GPS and satellite phones. Many adventurers are nature lovers who use their travels to help raise awareness about a range of environmental issues, while others are keen to help people in need and raise money for charities.

simplified: The first test is called DART. It stands for Double Asteroid Redirection Test. People plan to try DART on a small moon that goes around a big asteroid. The asteroid's name is Didymos. The small moon is called 'Didymoon'. It is 150 metres wide and it moves around the big asteroid, which is 800 metres wide. The plan is to crash DART into 'Didymoon' to change its path. If it works, telescopes on Earth will be able to see the change.
original: The first is DART – the Double Asteroid Redirection Test. Plans are scheduled to test DART on the moon of an asteroid called Didymos. 'Didymoon' is 150 metres wide, orbiting its 800-metre mother, and hopefully the impact of DART will knock it out of its orbit enough for Earth-based telescopes to pick up.

simplified: The main character of the story is a 16-year-old girl named Katniss Everdeen. She lost her father in a bad accident in a mine. Now she has to find food for her family. She goes hunting in the woods near her home in District 12 with her friend Gale. Katniss is very good at using a bow and arrow. One day, her younger sister Prim is chosen to take part in a dangerous game. Katniss decides to go instead of her sister. The other person from District 12 who has to play the game is a boy named Peeta. Katniss starts to have complicated feelings for Peeta.
original: The heroine of the story, a sixteen year old girl called Katniss Everdeen, has lost her father in a mining accident and has to provide food for her family. She hunts in the woods around District 12 with her friend Gale and becomes very skilful with a bow and arrow. When her younger sister, Prim, is chosen as one of the tributes, Katniss volunteers to go instead. The other tribute from District 12 is a boy named Peeta and Katniss soon finds herself in a complicated relationship with him.

simplified: Writing about your dreams helps you remember more about them. Think about the people in your dream and the place where it happened, because they can help you understand what your dream means. If you write down your dreams for a week, you will be surprised at how much you have written. Then, you can start to see how your dreams are connected to things that happen in your life and how you feel every day.
original: Writing about your dreams will mean you start to remember more details about the dream, so think about the people and place where the dream happened as they might add to the meaning too. Over the period of a week you'll be surprised how much you've written down. Now you can start connecting your dreams to the events and feelings in your daily life.

simplified: In the past, many bridges were made of wood and easily caught fire. This was especially true for old train bridges. When trains went over these bridges, sparks would fly because the train wheels and tracks were made of metal. Sometimes, these sparks would set the bridge on fire and it would burn down completely.
original: Historically, more bridges were made of wood and were much more susceptible to fire. This was particularly true of old-fashioned train bridges, where the spark created by the steel wheels and steel tracks could sometimes cause a bridge to catch fire and burn to the ground.

simplified: We can't know for sure what will happen to street art in the future, but some things are starting to happen. Most street artists are young and paint in their own city, but now more and more are travelling to other places to work. They are also using the internet to talk to each other and show pictures of what they've made. The art world is starting to take street art seriously, which means they think it's a real kind of art. Even though we don't know what's next, it's clear that street art is going to be around for a long time.
original: It is impossible to know how street art will develop in the future but certain trends are emerging. While most street artists are young people who paint in their city or neighbourhood, more and more street artists are travelling and working around the globe. Other artists are using the internet to talk to each other and share photos of their work. Also, the art world is giving more recognition to street art as a legitimate art form. Although we don't know what will happen to street art in the future, we can be sure that it is here to stay!

simplified: Suzanne Collines doesn't like watching news about wars. It makes her upset. When she was a kid, her dad was a pilot in the US Air Force. He went to fight in a war in Vietnam. Her mum tried to keep her safe by not telling her what was happening, but Suzanne still saw news about the war on TV. She knew her dad was there and it was very scary for her.
original: Suzanne Collines has always found news programmes of wars upsetting. When she was a child, her father was a pilot in the US Air Force and he fought in Vietnam. Her mother tried to protect her by not telling her what was happening in the war, but she still saw news programmes about the war and knew that her dad was there. It was a very frightening experience for her.

simplified: A big survey by PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) asked over 40,000 people, born between 1983 and 1993 and others, about their jobs. They wanted to know about the atmosphere at work, how people talk to each other, how they like to work, how much they get paid, how they can improve their careers, and how they balance work and free time. Another big survey by Deloitte asked over 10,000 young people about what they think are the good and bad things about having a job in today's complicated work world.
original: In a global survey conducted by PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), more than 40,000 millennial (born between 1983 and 1993) and non-millennial responses were collected on the topics of workplace culture, communication and working styles, pay structure, career development, work–life balance, etc. In a separate global survey conducted by Deloitte, more than 10,000 millennials participated in a study about their perceptions of the threats and opportunities in the complex world of work.

simplified: Erik Weihenmayer is from the United States. He likes adventure and has done many exciting things. He rode a bike across the desert in Morocco, went kayaking in the Grand Canyon, and climbed Mount Everest. What's amazing is that Erik is blind. He lost his sight when he was 13 years old. Erik wants to help people with disabilities to be active. He takes young blind people on climbing trips to show them they can do it too.
original: Erik Weihenmayer from the United States is a multi-adventurer. He's ridden a bike through the deserts of Morocco, kayaked through the Grand Canyon and climbed Everest. Amazingly, Erik has been blind since the age of 13. Apart from his travels, he tries to encourage people with disabilities to live active lives and takes groups of young blind people on climbing expeditions.

simplified: The internet is making it easy for people to make some extra money. For example, busy parents can now sell their kids' old things online, like clothes and baby equipment that they don't need anymore. Before, they might not have bothered selling these things at a local market, but now they can use websites to sell them and get some money back.
original: Democratised online platforms are providing a chance for people to make a quick buck or two. To give an example, busy parents previously might not have bothered with setting up a stall at the local market or car boot sale to sell their children's old equipment, but with online marketplaces, parents are now able to sell on those hardly worn baby clothes that their children have outgrown and the expensive pushchairs and baby equipment they have invested in, so as to put some cash back into their pockets.

simplified: Pi and Richard Parker are in the lifeboat for 227 days. They are very hungry, sick and tired. They go through big storms and very hot sun, but they don't give up. Sometimes, Pi feels better because of his three religions, but other times he feels very alone and sad. Then, they see the Mexican coast and everything changes. It's a surprise, so you should read the book to find out what happens to Pi and Richard Parker when they see land.
original: Pi and Richard Parker spend 227 days in the lifeboat. They live through hunger, illness and exhaustion. They endure violent storms and the burning heat of the Pacific sun, but somehow they survive. At times, Pi finds comfort in his three religions, but at other times he is overcome with loneliness and despair. Finally, the Mexican coast appears on the horizon and everything changes. It would be a shame to give away the ending, so you will have to read the book yourself to find out what happens to Pi and Richard Parker once land is in sight.

simplified: Chloe came home from school, made a cup of coffee, and went to her room. She had schoolwork to do, but it could wait. She wanted to enjoy the quiet time before her parents came home and the house got noisy with people talking, the TV on, or her dad listening to music while cooking dinner. She liked this time of day because she could play with her pet rats.
original: Chloe arrived home from school, made herself a cup of coffee and took it up to her bedroom. She had some homework to do, but that could wait for later. She wanted to enjoy the quiet hour before her parents arrived home and the house filled up with the evening sounds of chatter, television or her dad listening to his beloved jazz while he cooked dinner. She liked this time of day too because she could play with her pet rats.

simplified: In 2010, a team at NASA found and recorded 90 per cent of big rocks in space near Earth. These rocks are as big as mountains and are called 'near-Earth objects'. They are within 50 million kilometres of Earth's path around the sun. NASA found 887 of these rocks and thinks there are about 50 more to find. Luckily, none of the rocks they know about are a big threat to our planet. NASA is trying to find all these rocks to keep Earth safe.
original: In 2010, the planetary defence team at NASA had identified and logged 90 per cent of the asteroids near Earth measuring 1km wide. These 'near-Earth objects', or NEOs, are the size of mountains and include anything within 50 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. With an estimated 50 left to log, NASA says none of the 887 it knows about are a significant danger to the planet.

simplified: Auggie decides to go to school. Now he has to face his first day. Like all kids who start at a new school, he is very nervous. But for Auggie, it's even harder because of how he looks. Nobody wants to sit next to him. He sees other kids looking at him or talking about him when they think he can't hear. Luckily, he makes friends with Jack, a boy in his class, and Summer, a girl he talks to at lunch. But it's not just the first day that's difficult. Auggie soon finds out that his classmates don't want to touch him because they think they might get sick. As the school year goes on, Auggie has many good and bad times. Then, something very sad and shocking happens at a school camp, and everything changes.
original: Having decided to go to school, Auggie then has to face his first day. Like every child starting at a new school, he is really anxious. But because of the way he looks, it's an agonising experience. Nobody wants to sit next to him and he notices other kids staring at him or talking about him behind their hands. Fortunately, he makes friends with Jack, a boy in his class, and Summer, a girl he chats with at lunch. But it's not just the first day that's hard. Auggie soon learns that his classmates don't want to touch him for fear of catching 'the plague'. As he goes through the school year, Auggie goes through many intense ups and downs till finally an unexpected and traumatic event at a school camp changes things completely.

simplified: The two men looked at the north part of the land. It went on and on as far as they could see. The fences were hard to spot from where they were standing. A teenager might get very bored and want to run away, but it was impossible to walk out of there. Sam looked at the biggest horse, which was kicking the ground with its big feet. He thought, "Can the boy ride a horse?" If the boy was a good rider, he could get into a lot of trouble out here, far from people. But maybe it was even more dangerous for someone who didn't know how to ride and wanted to escape from his dad.
original: The two men looked towards the northern end of the property. It stretched as far as the eye could see. Even the fences were barely visible from where they stood. However bored and rebellious a teenage boy might get, it wasn't possible to escape on foot. Sam looked at the biggest of the horses, kicking at the ground with its heavy hooves. Could the boy ride? he wondered. There was a whole load of trouble a good rider could get into out here, miles away from anyone. But maybe there was even more trouble for someone who knew nothing about horses and wanted to get away from his father.

simplified: More than 4,000 people have climbed to the top of Everest. They were between 13 and 80 years old. Climbing high mountains in very cold weather and bad storms is still very dangerous. But the best climbers in the world now want to try new and harder things. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner is from Austria. She started to love climbing mountains when she was a teenager. After she finished school, she worked as a nurse. But she still climbed mountains in her free time.
original: Over 4,000 climbers, aged from thirteen to eighty have been to the top of Everest. Though climbing high mountains in freezing conditions and violent storms is still extremely dangerous, the world's best climbers now look for new challenges. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner from Austria fell in love with mountain climbing as a teenager. When she left school, she worked as a nurse, but kept climbing in her free time.

simplified: Gerlinde climbed the highest mountain, Everest. Now she wants to climb all the other very high mountains in the world. There are fourteen mountains that are over 8,000 metres high. She wants to make it harder for herself, so she climbs without extra oxygen. This is dangerous because there's not enough oxygen in the air at the top of high mountains, and that can hurt her brain and body. Gerlinde is famous for climbing, and she uses this to help a charity that supports poor kids and children without parents in Nepal.
original: Having climbed Everest, Gerlinde decided to climb all fourteen of the world's 8,000 metre peaks. To increase the challenge, Gerlinde climbs without using oxygen tanks. This is risky as low oxygen levels at the top of high mountains can affect brain and body functioning. Gerlinde uses her fame as a climber to support a charity for poor children and orphans in Nepal.

simplified: If we look around at the things we have bought, we will see that we don't use everything we own. For example, we might have a thick winter coat that we thought was cool, but we live in a hot country, so we don't need it. We might have an old phone that we stopped using when we got a new one. We might have a car that we only use on Saturdays and Sundays. Some people even have a room in their house for guests, but they use it to store things instead.
original: If we look around us at the things we have purchased at some point in our lives, we would no doubt notice that not everything we own is being put to good use: the thick woollen coat which we thought looked trendy despite the fact that we live in a tropical country, the smartphone that got put away when we bought ourselves the newest model, the car that only gets used at the weekends, or even the guest room in our house that somehow got turned into a storeroom.

simplified: Throughout history, people have believed that dreams can tell us about the future. A long time ago, people thought dreams were messages from gods, giving us information or warning us about something. Even now, many people remember a dream they had about something that then really happened. They dreamed about a place, a person, or an event, and later it came true in their life.
original: Throughout history and across cultures, dreams have been associated with prophecy. People thought dreams were messages from the gods, sent to give us knowledge or insight. Even today, many people can recall a time they dreamed about an event, place or person and then, later, the dream came true in real life.

simplified: Some of the biggest and most expensive transportation projects involve building bridges. Bridges are very important because they allow cars, trucks, and trains to cross water, mountains, or other roads. They are a key part of civil engineering and people pay close attention to them, especially when they fail.
original: Some of the biggest and most expensive transportation projects in the world have involved building bridges. Bridges are crucial links that carry cars, trucks and trains across bodies of water, mountain gorges or other roads. As a result, they are one of the most important aspects of civil engineering and are subject to intense scrutiny, especially when they collapse.

simplified: Gabriela was getting very frustrated, so she sent an email to her boss in Sweden about the problems she was having with her team. Her boss just asked if her team was still doing a good job and what she thought would help her work better with them. Gabriela thought her boss wasn't being clear and didn't think he was handling the situation well.
original: After weeks of frustration, Gabriela emailed her Swedish manager about the issues she was facing with her team. Her manager simply asked her if she felt her team was still performing, and what she thought would help her better collaborate with her team members. Gabriela found her manager vague and didn't feel as if he was managing the situation satisfactorily.

simplified: Dogs that live in groups have learned that people are more likely to give food to smaller, cuter dogs. So, these dogs go and ask for food for the rest of the group. Some dogs have even learned how to use the city's underground trains to get from one part of their area to another. Scientists are not sure how the dogs know when to get off the train. One idea is that they use their good sense of smell to recognize the places they like to go to. Another idea is that they recognize the names of the train stations from the announcements. Either way, people who use the trains are now so used to seeing dogs on the trains that they don't really notice them anymore.
original: Dogs that live in packs have learnt that humans are more likely to give food to smaller, cuter dogs so those dogs are sent to beg for food for the whole pack. Some dogs have even learnt to use the city's metro system to get from one part of their territory to another! Scientists are not sure how the dogs know when to get off the train. One idea is that they use their excellent sense of smell and have learnt to recognise the scents of their favourite destinations. Another possibility is that they have learnt to recognise the names of stations they hear in announcements. Either way, metro passengers have now got so used to the sight of dogs on the trains that they travel largely unnoticed by locals.

simplified: Ed Stafford from the UK did something amazing. He was the first person to walk along the whole Amazon River. He started near a small river in the Andes mountains in Peru and finished at the river's end in Brazil. It took him two years and four months to walk 6,000 kilometres. The Amazon is a big area of forest with many dangers like poisonous snakes, crocodiles, and big cats called jaguars. Ed was in danger all the time, but he was lucky. He got bitten by mosquitoes and ants many times, but that was all.
original: Ed Stafford from the UK is the first person to walk the length of the Amazon River. He started by a small stream in the Andes mountains of Peru and arrived at the river's mouth in Brazil, two years and four months later, having walked 6,000 kilometres. The Amazon rainforest is home to poisonous snakes, crocodiles and jaguars, so Ed was in constant danger. Luckily, he survived with nothing worse than a few thousand mosquito and ant bites.

simplified: In Britain, people spend a lot of money on new clothes. On average, they spend over £1,000 per year. This is about four per cent of the money they earn. This might not seem like a big problem, but it hides two bigger issues. One problem is that people often buy clothes with credit cards. This means they are spending money they don't have. Right now, each adult in Britain owes around £670 to credit card companies. This is a lot of money, and it's about 66 per cent of what people spend on clothes. The other problem is that people buy things they don't need. Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothes every year. Most of these clothes end up in places where trash is kept, which is bad for the environment.
original: In Britain, the average person spends more than £1,000 on new clothes a year, which is around four per cent of their income. That might not sound like much, but that figure hides two far more worrying trends for society and for the environment. First, a lot of that consumer spending is via credit cards. British people currently owe approximately £670 per adult to credit card companies. That's 66 per cent of the average wardrobe budget. Also, not only are people spending money they don't have, they're using it to buy things they don't need. Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothing a year, most of which goes into landfill sites.

simplified: Ed's walk wouldn't have been possible without modern tools. He used a radio to talk to the people living in the rainforest, asking for food and permission to walk through their area. Many of them came to meet him and showed him the way through the toughest parts. As Ed walked, he wrote about his daily adventures on the internet. He used the fact that many people were interested in his trip to speak out against the harm being done to the rainforest and to collect money for good causes that help the environment and children in Brazil and Peru.
original: Ed's walk would have been impossible without technology. He used a radio to ask the people of the rainforest for food and permission to cross their land. Many of them came to meet him and helped guide him through the most difficult terrain. As he walked Ed wrote a blog, recording his day-to-day experiences. He used the media interest in his trip to protest about the destruction of the rainforest and raise money for environmental and children's charities in Brazil and Peru.

simplified: Many companies have seen that they can make money from the sharing economy. They want to use things that people do not use all the time. Some companies have created websites that connect customers with people who can provide something they need. For example, Airbnb is a website that helps people rent out their empty rooms or houses to others. This way, people can make money from something they are not using. Another example is Uber, which is a service that lets people use their own cars as taxis when they are not using them. This way, people can earn some extra money in their free time.
original: Businesses have caught on to the profitability of the sharing economy and are seeking to gain from making use of those underutilised resources. A business model that has rapidly risen in popularity sees companies providing an online platform that puts customers in contact with those who can provide a particular product or service. Companies like Airbnb act as a middleman for people to cash in on their unused rooms and houses and let them out as lucrative accommodation. Another example is Uber, which encourages people to use their own personal cars as taxis to make some extra cash in their free time.

simplified: One of the most important jobs of zoos today is to help animals breed. This is especially true for animals that are in danger of disappearing. In the wild, these animals often have trouble finding a mate to have babies with. They are also in danger from people who hunt them, from losing their homes, and from other animals that might hurt them. A good zoo provides a safe place for these animals to live and have babies. When there are not many of a certain kind of animal left in the wild, they can become too similar to each other. This can be a problem. Zoos can help by breeding animals and then releasing them into the wild. This helps to make sure that the animals in the wild are not all too similar.
original: One of the most important modern functions of zoos is supporting international breeding programmes, particularly for endangered species. In the wild, some of the rarest species have difficulty in finding mates and breeding, and they might also be threatened by poachers, loss of their habitat and predators. A good zoo will enable these species to live and breed in a secure environment. In addition, as numbers of some wild species drop, there is an increased danger of populations becoming too genetically similar. Breeding programmes provide a safeguard: zoo-bred animals can be released into the wild to increase genetic diversity.

simplified: These kinds of accidents are very rare, but boats and trains can make a bridge fall down for different reasons. With trains, it's how fast they hit the bridge that can make it collapse. With boats, it's how heavy they are that can make the bridge fall, even if they are moving slowly. The best way to stop bridges from falling is to plan ahead. New technologies that can find weak spots, safer work conditions, and better designs can all help prevent these terrible accidents.
original: Both of these kinds of accidents are extremely rare, but boats and trains can cause a bridge to collapse for different reasons. With trains, it's the velocity of the impact that can bring a bridge down. With boats, it's the very large mass they have that can bring about the collapse, even if they are moving very slowly when it occurs. The best way to avoid bridge failures is to plan for them. Modern technologies that can detect structural weakness, safer working environments and better designs can all help to reduce these terrible accidents.

simplified: At first, Pi is very scared of the animals and jumps into the sea. Then he remembers that there are dangerous sharks in the water and realizes he has to get back into the small boat. The animals in the boat start fighting and eating each other, until only Pi and a big tiger are left. Luckily for Pi, the tiger, who he calls Richard Parker, feels sick from the boat moving and isn't interested in eating him right now.
original: At first, Pi is terrified of the animals and jumps into the ocean. Then he remembers that there are hungry sharks in the water around him and realises his only option is to climb back into the lifeboat. One by one, the animals in the lifeboat kill and eat each other, till only Pi and the tiger are left. Fortunately for Pi, the tiger, who he names Richard Parker, is seasick and has no immediate interest in eating him.

simplified: When Pi is 16, a new government is chosen that his parents don't like. They are worried about what will happen next, so they decide to close the zoo and move to Canada. They sell some of the animals to other zoos in North America and take the rest with them on a ship to Canada. On the way, a very bad storm happens and the ship goes underwater. Sadly, Pi's family and the people working on the ship all die in the water, but Pi is lucky and finds himself in a small boat with a hyena, a zebra, an orang-utan, and a very big tiger.
original: When Pi is 16, a new government is elected that his parents don't support. Worried about the future, Pi's parents decide to close the zoo and emigrate to Canada. Some of the animals are sold to zoos in North America and the family travel by ship to Canada taking the animals with them. On the way, there is a terrible storm and the ship sinks. Tragically, Pi's family and the ship's sailors all drown, but Pi finds himself in a lifeboat with a hyena, zebra, orang-utan and an enormous tiger.

simplified: The Hunger Games is a very popular book for teenagers and young people. It was written by American author Suzanne Collins and published in 2008. Since then, it has been translated into 26 languages and sold a lot of copies worldwide. It's the first book for young readers to sell over a million digital copies. The book has also been made into a big Hollywood movie, which is very successful too. In its first weekend in the US and Canada, it made a huge amount of money - $152.5 million!
original: The Hunger Games is a hugely successful book for teenagers and young adults by the American author Suzanne Collins. Since it was published in 2008 it has been translated into 26 different languages and has sold millions of copies around the world. It is also the first book for young readers to sell more than a million electronic copies. The Hunger Games is now a major Hollywood film and is just as successful. It made 152.5 million dollars in its opening weekend in North America alone!

simplified: Maybe dreams are what happens when our brain puts together the things we think about during the day, but in a different way. When we're awake, we think with words, like when we talk to ourselves. But when we're asleep, the part of our brain that helps us use language doesn't work as much, and the part that helps us feel emotions works more. This is why our dreams can have special meanings that are not just simple words.
original: Maybe dreams are the result of our mind organising the thoughts we have during the day, but they appear in dreams with symbolic meaning. When we're awake, our thoughts mostly appear in our minds as words, like conversations we have with ourselves. But when we're asleep, the part of our brain that controls language becomes less active while the part that controls emotions becomes more active.

simplified: Having good friends and family is important for being happy. A study showed that happy people often have close friends and family and spend time with them regularly. It's also good to have someone you can talk to about your feelings. You don't need many people like this, just one is okay. It's not enough to just have friends to do things with or talk about hobbies. You need friends you can really talk to and feel close to. Some people need to learn how to listen to others better so they can have stronger friendships.
original: Having good relationships is a big part of being happy. In one study, most happy people were found to have strong ties to friends and family and they made sure they spent time with them regularly. You also need at least one person who you discuss personal feelings with – called 'self-disclosure'. Just one person for a heart-to-heart is enough, together with a network of other relationships. It's not enough to have lots of friends just to do things with or chat to about music or football. That deeper connection is all-important. Some people need to learn how to listen effectively to others in order to develop stronger relationships.

simplified: Carol Dweck is a psychologist who says our brain can change and we can get better at things we are not good at first. Many people praise others for what they are naturally good at, like saying "You are really good at paying attention to details" or "You are great at organising parties". But research shows that it's better to praise how people do things, like saying "You tried really hard" or "You found a good way to solve this problem". This helps people learn new things and get even better at what they can already do.
original: Psychologist and 'growth mindset' proponent Carol Dweck spoke of the plasticity of the brain and our ability to develop skills and talents that we might not have been good at to start with. Many of us tend to focus our praise on the end result and seemingly innate talents, e.g. 'You really have an eye for details' or 'You have a real talent for organising events'. However, research suggests that by focusing on the process of how things are done – praising effort, experimentation and problem-solving strategies – we can encourage the development of new skills and the continued honing of talents.

simplified: The rover checks the air around it from time to time. In 2014, it found a simple organic molecule called methane in the air. Methane is a key part of natural gas. One important thing about methane is that it doesn't last very long - only a few hundred years. This means that something on Mars must be making more methane to replace the old methane. NASA says that Mars sometimes releases a lot of methane into the air - thousands of tons at a time. The amount of methane in the air goes up and down during the year, like the planet is taking breaths.
original: The rover analyses the air around it periodically, and in 2014 it found the air contained another of the most basic organic molecules and a key ingredient of natural gas: methane. One of the characteristics of methane is that it only survives a few hundred years. This means that something, somewhere on Mars, is replenishing the supply. According to NASA, Mars emits thousands of tons of methane at a time. The level of methane rises and falls at seasonal intervals in the year, almost as if the planet is breathing it.

simplified: A psychologist named Carol Dweck from Stanford University did an experiment with 10-year-old kids. She gave them problems that were a bit too difficult. Some kids were happy to try and said they enjoyed the challenge. They believed they could get better with practice. Dweck calls this a "growth mindset", which means they think about what they can do in the future. On the other hand, some kids felt bad because they thought they weren't smart enough and had failed. They had a "fixed mindset", which means they thought their abilities wouldn't change. Some of these kids said they might cheat next time, while others looked for someone who did worse to feel better about themselves.
original: Early in her career, the psychologist Carol Dweck of Stanford University gave a group of ten-year-olds problems that were slightly too hard for them. One group reacted positively, said they loved challenge and understood that their abilities could be developed. She says they had a 'growth mindset' and are focused on what they can achieve in the future. But another group of children felt that their intelligence was being judged and they had failed. They had a 'fixed mindset' and were unable to imagine improving. Some of these children said they might cheat in the future; others looked for someone who had done worse than them to boost their self-esteem.

simplified: Horror movies often take place in empty and scary locations. These can be old hospitals, empty houses or ghost towns. There's something frightening about places where nobody lives. What was life like when people were there? Why did they leave? These places are also very quiet, which can be scary. Another good thing about these locations for movie makers is that it's easy to believe you can't get a phone signal there.
original: Horror films love uninhabited places. This could be an abandoned hospital, a scary empty house or a ghost town. There's something about lonely, empty places. What was it like when people lived there? Why did they leave? Maybe it's also that they are so quiet, which can be very scary too. Of course, abandoned places are also handy for horror film directors in that it's more believable that you will have no phone coverage there either.

simplified: In horror movies, the basement is always a frightening place. It's where something bad is often hiding or where the bad person keeps their bad things. Basements are usually dark and wet. You have to go down a small set of stairs to get there. They are always a bit spooky, even when there's nothing scary downstairs.
original: No matter what kind of house it is, the basement is a scary place in horror films. That's usually where something is hiding or where the evil psychopath has hidden their tools. Basements are always dark and often damp. You can only reach them by a narrow staircase. And basements are always creepy, even when there isn't anything down there.

simplified: Gary Collins, a policeman who was not working at the time, was watching the London riots on TV. He saw some people he knew and decided to cut his holiday short to help the police. He spent six months looking at videos from security cameras and was able to identify 190 people, often just by looking at their eyes. His help was very important for the investigation. The police had a lot of video to look at - 200,000 hours - but special computer software that can recognize faces was only able to identify one person.
original: Gary Collins, an off-duty policeman, was watching the London riots on TV. He immediately recognised several people and cut his holiday short to help with identification. He ended up spending six months going through the CCTV film and managed to identify 190 people, many from their eyes alone. His help was of decisive importance in the investigation. Even with 200,000 hours of footage, facial recognition software managed to identify just one person.

simplified: I think it's really interesting to think about how we can improve ourselves as humans by adding technology to our bodies. Imagine if you could put a tiny computer in your head! Soon we'll be able to do this and it will help us with maths, seeing and hearing, and remembering things. This idea will become normal soon.
original: Personally, I think it's fascinating to consider how we'll speed up our evolution as a species by augmenting our bodies. Imagine if you could implant a computer inside our brain! Soon we'll be able to do just that and enhance our mathematical ability, audiovisual perception and our memory, and this idea is only going to become more and more commonplace.

simplified: The talk was really interesting and the speaker said some very true things. For example, she talked about how parents influence their children. If parents use their phones while cooking dinner or waiting for the traffic light to turn green, how can they expect their kids not to use their phones while doing homework? The speaker also said that people want to be in many places at the same time. So, they switch between talking to people in person and talking to others online. I see this a lot with my teenage daughter and her friends. They plan to meet, but when they're together, they sit quietly and each one talks to someone else online.
original: It was a fascinating talk and the speaker really hit the nail on the head with a couple of things. Take parental influence, for instance. How can we expect teenagers not to text while doing their homework when they witness their parents posting on social media while cooking the evening meal or waiting at a red light? She also made a valid point about people wanting to be in two or several places at once. So they switch back and forth between their real-life and online conversations. I see it all the time with my teenage daughter and her friends. They arrange to meet and then sit together in silence while each one engages in a different conversation online.

simplified: When we watch the news, it can seem like the world is becoming a more violent place. But there are some positive things to think about too. After World War II, there were many wars that killed a lot of people - 30 wars killed more than 100,000 people. Now, countries are generally living together more peacefully. However, there are still some wars within countries and terrorism has increased in recent years. Sadly, many more civilians than soldiers have died in wars since World War II. But even for civilians, the situation is not all bad. Although people are more likely to die from violent crime than from war, the number of murders worldwide has actually gone down. In 2000, about 8 people out of 100,000 were murdered, but by 2015, this number had decreased to about 5.3 people per 100,000.
original: As for news stories that make us think the world is an increasingly violent place, there is cause for some optimism too. Between the end of World War II and 1990, there were 30 wars that killed more than 100,000 people. Today there are still civil wars, but countries are mostly co-existing more peacefully than in the past. However, terrorism has shot up in the last few years and, since World War II, wars have killed many more civilians than soldiers. Even for civilians, though, the statistics are not all bad. Although deaths are nine times more likely to be a result of violent crime than political conflict, the global murder rate fell slightly, from 8 per 100,000 people in 2000 to about 5.3 in 2015.

simplified: Wasfia has spent her life helping people have equal rights.
